message.content:
cs.CG, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CG (Computational Geometry) - The paper uses ideas from high-dimensional convex geometry to analyze the behavior of convex sets under random projection. 
2. cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) - The paper discusses an application of the theoretical results to compressive classification in the context of hyperspectral imaging. 
3. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper provides bounds for linearly separable classification of convex sets, which is a fundamental problem in machine learning. 
4. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper uses mathematical tools from convex geometry to analyze the behavior of convex sets under random projection, which is relevant to the design of efficient algorithms for high-dimensional data. 
5. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the problem of compressive classification, which involves acquiring data via very few measurements, and provides theoretical bounds on the performance of such methods. This is related to the study of compressed sensing and information theory.
